meanings.definition: Not able to be seen or detected.
meanings.sent1: The ghost was unobservable to the human eye.
meanings.sent2: The stars in the daytime sky are unobservable.
meanings.sent3: The ninja's stealth was so unobservable that even the guard didn't notice.
meanings.sent4: Her emotions were like an unobservable ocean, calm on the surface but turbulent underneath.
meanings.sent5: The secret entrance to the cave was unobservable unless you knew where to look.

meanings.definition: Unable to be observed or perceived.
meanings.sent1: The microscopic organisms were unobservable without a powerful microscope.
meanings.sent2: The subtle changes in the painting were unobservable to the untrained eye.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick was so unobservable that the audience was left in awe.
meanings.sent4: His influence on the team was like an unobservable force, guiding them from behind the scenes.
meanings.sent5: The passage of time was almost unobservable in the peaceful garden.
